resources:
Hapros
Capsule Name: "HAPROS I"
Launch Date: June 4, 2016
Launched From: Wendover, UT
Altitude Reached: Unknown
Recovery Status: Not Recovered
Recovery Location: Projected to be in the vicinity of Pilot Peak, NV, but never found.
About: This launch was prepared for by putting the mascot, Larry the Lemur, through free fall training. Capsule Name: "Hapros II"
Launch Date: May 31, 2017
Launched From: Dugway, UT
Altitude Reached: Unknown
Recovery Status: Not Recovered
Recovery Location: Landed in restricted military property in the Cedar Mountains. Could not be subsequently recovered.
About: First year to use Lux the penguin as the mascot, which was used each subsequent year. Capsule Name: "HAPROS III"
Launch Date: May 19, 2018
Launched From: Corrine, UT
Altitude Reached: 112,000 feet
Recovery Status: Recovered
Recovery Location: Bear River City
About: A picture from this launch placed third in the Utah State Fair photography contest. Capsule Name: "Douglas M. Burr"
Launch Date: May 11, 2019
Launched From: Cherry Creek, ID
Altitude Reached: 115,000 feet
Recovery Status: Recovered
Recovery Location: Backyard field in Garland, UT
About: HAPROS IV's capsule was shaped after NASA's Apollo capsules to celebrate 50 years from the moon landing. Capsule Name: "Off-Nominal"
Launch Date: May 18, 2021
Launched From: Corrine, UT
Altitude Reached: 100,000 feet
Recovery Status: Recovered
Recovery Location: Lower fairing at the base of Little Mountain. Upper fairing recovered in Honeyville
About: HAPROS V's capsule was an approximate scale replica of SpaceX's Crew Dragon. Capsule Name: "Off-Nominal"
Launch Date: May 18, 2021
Launched From: Corrine, UT
Altitude Reached: 101,000
Recovery Status: Recovered
Recovery Location: Lower fairing at the base of Little Mountain. Upper fairing recovered in Honeyville
About: HAPROS V's capsule was an approximate scale replica of SpaceX's Crew Dragon. Capsule Name: "PLS DON'T SHOOT"
Launch Date: May 18, 2021
Launched From: Corrine, UT
Altitude Reached: TBD
Recovery Status: Recovered
Recovery Location: Lower fairing at the base of Little Mountain. Upper fairing recovered in Honeyville
About: HAPROS V's capsule was an approximate scale replica of SpaceX's Crew Dragon.
Hello blank fragment
HAPROS I HAPROS II HAPROS III HAPROS IV HAPROS V HAPROS VI HAPROS VII
App Developers> Launch Team> Engineering Team> Instructors>

Ben Michaelis>
The High Altitude Pi Reaching Outer Stratosphere (HAPROS) mission is a project by Mr. Thomsen's Linux class at Tooele County School District's Community Learning Center

 The Goal:
 The goal of this project is to send a payload to near space, and track it using a very small computer called a Raspberry Pi running a lean but powerful operating system called Linux.
Joe Griffith - Telemetry, Payload, Imagery
 Ella - Telemetry, Imagery
